sen.j: 文室 綿麻呂（ふんや の わたまろ、天平神護元年（765年） - 弘仁14年4月24日 (旧暦)（823年6月6日））は、平安時代前期の征夷大将軍、公卿。
sen.e: FUNYA no Watamaro (male, 765 to June 6th, 823) was the seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") and kugyo (a minister) in the first half of Heian Period.
FUNYA no Watamaro (male, 765 to June 6th, 823) was a seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") and kugyo (a minister) in the first half of the Heian Period.
FUNYA no Watamaro (765 to June 10, 823) was a seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") and kugyo (a minister) in the first half of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: male→原文にないため削除、ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正、Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: 三諸大原の長男。
sen.e: Watamaro was the first son of Ohara MIMORO.
Watamaro was the first son of Ohara MIMORO.
Watamaro was the first son of Ohara MIMORO.

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 歴戦の将軍であったことから平城天皇の信任を得ていた。
sen.e: Because Watamaro was a general who had won many battles, he was trusted by the Emperor Heijo.
Because Watamaro was a general who had won many battles, he was trusted by the Emperor Heijo.
Because Watamaro was a general who had won many battles, he was trusted by the Emperor Heijo.

sen.j: そのため薬子の変では囚われの身となるが、鎮圧軍の坂上田村麻呂の助命嘆願もあり命を救われている。
sen.e: Therefore, he was held in captivity, however, his life was saved by some reasons including the appeal by SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro in the suppressing army for saving his life.
Therefore, he was held in captivity, however, his life was saved by some reasons including the appeal by SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro in the suppressing army for saving his life.
Therefore, he was held in captivity at the Kusuko Incident, however, his life was saved by some reasons including the appeal by SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro in the suppressing army for saving his life.
sen.cmt: 「薬子の変では」→訳漏れのため訳出対応しました。

sen.j: その後、田村麻呂とともに平城上皇の東国での再起計画を阻止した。
sen.e: After this, with SAKANOUE noTamuramaro, Watamaro prevented the plan of the Retired Emperor Heijo to revive in an eastern province.
After this, with SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, Watamaro prevented the plan of the Retired Emperor Heijo to revive in an eastern province.
After this, with SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, Watamaro prevented the plan of the Retired Emperor Heijo to revive in an eastern province.

sen.j: 乱後、その功績を認められ参議に任ぜられる。
sen.e: After the war, Watamaro was appointed to sangi because his performance in the war was appreciated.
After the war, Watamaro was appointed to sangi because his performance in the war was appreciated.
After the war, Watamaro was appointed to sangi (royal advisor) because his performance in the war was appreciated.

sen.j: 高位高官でありながら、田村麻呂に随行し、蝦夷征討に従う。
sen.e: Though Watamaro was a highly ranked official, he accompanied Tamuramaro and joined Tamuramaro's Ezo suppression.
Though Watamaro was a highly ranked official, he accompanied Tamuramaro and joined Tamuramaro's Ezo suppression.
Though Watamaro was a highly ranked official, he accompanied Tamuramaro and joined Tamuramaro's Ezo suppression.

sen.j: 田村麻呂の死後、その遺志を奉じて蝦夷征討の任にあたる。
sen.e: After Tamuramaro died, Watamaro respected Tamuramaro's will and succeeded to the position to suppress Ezo.
After Tamuramaro died, Watamaro respected Tamuramaro's will and succeeded to the position to suppress Ezo.
After Tamuramaro died, Watamaro respected Tamuramaro's will and succeeded to the position to suppress Ezo.

sen.j: 東北経営の礎を築いた名将といえる。
sen.e: Watamaro can be said to be the great general who founded the bases of the management of Tohoku Region.
Watamaro can be said to be the great general who founded the bases of the management of the Tohoku Region.
Watamaro can be said to be the great general who founded the bases of the management of the Tohoku region.
sen.cmt: Regionの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: - 三諸大原の長男として誕生。
sen.e: Watamaro was born as a first son of Ohara MIMORO.
Watamaro was born as the first son of Ohara MIMORO.
Watamaro was born as the first son of Ohara MIMORO.

sen.j: - 三山朝臣と改姓,ついで文室真人の姓を賜る。
sen.e: Watamaro changed his family name to MIYAMAASON and he was given a family name of FUNYAMASATO.
Watamaro changed his family name to MIYAMAASON and he was given a family name of FUNYAMASATO.
Watamaro changed his family name to Miyama no Ason and he was given a family name of Funya no Mahito.
sen.cmt: MIYAMAASON→Miyama no Ason、FUNYAMASATO→Funya no Mahitoとしました。

sen.j: - 薬子の変。
sen.e: Yakushi no Hen
Yakushi no Hen
The Kusuko Incident
sen.cmt: Yakushi no Hen→The Kusuko Incidentに修正

sen.j: 平城上皇に従い捕縛され左衛士府に禁固されるが、坂上田村麻呂の助命嘆願により一命を助けられる。
sen.e: Watamaro followed the Retired Emperor Heijo, was captured, and confined in saeishi-fu, however, he was saved by the appeal by the SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro for saving his life.
Watamaro followed the Retired Emperor Heijo, was captured, and confined in saeishi-fu, however, he was saved by the appeal of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro for saving his life.

Watamaro followed the Retired Emperor Heijo, was captured, and confined in Saejifu (Left Division of the Palace Guards), however, he was saved by the appeal of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro for saving his life.

sen.j: その後、田村麻呂とともに上皇の東国再起計画を阻止する。
sen.e: After this, with SAKANOUE noTamuramaro, Watamaro prevented the plan of the Retired Emperor Heijo to revive in an eastern province.
After this, with SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, Watamaro prevented the plan of the Retired Emperor Heijo to revive in an eastern province.
After this, with SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro, Watamaro prevented the plan of the Retired Emperor Heijo to revive in an eastern province.

sen.j: その功績により参議、大蔵省、陸奥出羽按察使に任ぜられる。
sen.e: Because of that performance, Watamaro was appointed to sangi, an official in the Finance Ministry, and a stationing observer for Mutsu and Dewa Provinces.
Because of that performance, Watamaro was appointed to sangi, an official in the Finance Ministry, and a stationing observer for Mutsu and Dewa Provinces.
Because of that performance, Watamaro was appointed to sangi, an official in the Ministry of the Treasury, and Mutsu-Dewa Azechi (local inspector of Mutsu and Dewa Provinces).
sen.cmt: 「大蔵省」「陸奥出羽按察使」の表記を修正

sen.j: - 陸奥出羽按察使征夷将軍に任ぜられ、爾薩体（「にさったい」あるいは「にさて」）、弊伊（へい）の2村の蝦夷を平定。
sen.e: Watamaro was appointed to the stationing observer for Mutsu and Dewa Provinces and seii taishogun and suppressed two Ezo villages of Nisattai (or Nisate) and Hei.
Watamaro was appointed to the stationing observer for Mutsu and Dewa Provinces and seii taishogun and suppressed two Ezo villages of Nisattai (or Nisate) and Hei.
Watamaro was appointed to Mutsu-Dewa Azechi and seii taishogun and suppressed two Ezo villages of Nisattai (or Nisate) and Hei.
sen.cmt: 「陸奥出羽按察使」→前の表記に合わせ、Mutsu-Dewa Azechiとしました。

sen.j: - 徳丹城を築城。
sen.e: Watamaro constructed Tokunin-jo castle.
Watamaro constructed Tokunin-jo castle.
Watamaro constructed Tokutan-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: Tokunin-jo→Tokutan-joに修正、castleの頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: - 征夷大将軍に任ぜられる。
sen.e: Watamaro was appointed to seii taishogun.
Watamaro was appointed to seii taishogun.
Watamaro was appointed to seii taishogun.

sen.j: - 近衛大将、兵部省に任ぜられ、中納言に進んだ。
sen.e: Watamaro was appointed to konoetaisho and hyobusho and was promoted to chunagon.
Watamaro was appointed to konoetaisho and hyobusho and was promoted to chunagon.
Watamaro was appointed to Konoe no daisho (Major Captain of the Palace Guards) and Hyobusho (Ministry of Military) and was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 「近衛大将」「兵部省」「中納言」の表記を修正、補足追加

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 祖父 智努王（ふんやのちぬ）別名 文室浄三。
sen.e: Grandfather: FUNYA no Chinu (o/a FUNYA no Jozo).
Grandfather: FUNYA no Chinu (o/a FUNYA no Jozo).
Grandfather: FUNYA no Chinu (o/a FUNYA no Jozo).

sen.j: 別字に「珍努」がある。
sen.e: This name "Chinu" had two ways of writing in Chinese characters.
This name "Chinu" had two ways of writing in Chinese characters.
This name 'Chinu' had two ways of writing in Chinese characters.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 父 三諸大原
sen.e: Father: Ohara MIMORO
Father: Ohara MIMORO
Father: Ohara MIMORO

sen.j: 弟 文室秋津
sen.e: Younger brother: FUNYA no Akitsu
Younger brother: FUNYA no Akitsu
Younger brother: FUNYA no Akitsu

sen.j: 弟 文室宮田麻呂
sen.e: Younger brother: FUNYA no Miyatamaro
Younger brother: FUNYA no Miyatamaro
Younger brother: FUNYA no Miyatamaro

sen.j: 弟 文室海田麻呂
sen.e: Younger brother: BUNYA no Umidamaro
Younger brother: BUNYA no Umidamaro
Younger brother: BUNYA no Umidamaro

sen.j: 子 文室巻雄
sen.e: Child: FUNYA no Makio
Child: FUNYA no Makio
Child: FUNYA no Makio

sen.j: 子 文室氏雄
sen.e: Child: FUNYA no Ujio
Child: FUNYA no Ujio
Child: FUNYA no Ujio

sen.j: 子 文室能雄
sen.e: Child: FUNYA no Atao
Child: FUNYA no Atao
